data.title: A Local Favorite
data.text: A chief owned local favorite. The menu has a variety of local favorites that are reasonably priced options to pick from .The menu also has  a wine list to compliment it. Kristoffer Tea was our server. He was attentive to our request , had great customer service and in tune with the menu . For starters try Crisp Brussel Sprouts. It is priced at $12.00 but worth it. Brussel Sprouts are composed of almonds, and cheese. The flavors combine were immaculate. The flavors just become alive. For main course I suggest Grilled Swordfish, served with eggplant purée and sided with arugula which was reasonably priced at $24.00. To top it off your dinner with a local desert is a must. We had Michelle's Pumpkin Dobberge . It consist of cream cheese and local persimmon spiced rum ice cream . One word sums up the evening . Amazing!

data.title: What a great restaurant!
data.text: I was so impressed. The decor is understated, relaxed but elegant. The food is exceptional. The wait staff outstanding.

data.title: Affordable, great food, vibes, service
data.text:
I met some locals at a bar who told me I had to try out John Besch's chain of restaurants so I decided to go to Luke's which is a mix of German and French cuisine (I think). Walked in, set up was rally niche and modern. Was expecting meals to be a bit more pricey.

Meals were extremely affordable. I had the Thursday special which was something like $22USD with a soup to start then a jambalaya main (or Americans call it entree) . There were 6 of us and we all enjoyed our food. No complaints at all about anything. The service was great!

Highly recommend this place and I would be keen to try it again or his chain of restaurants.

data.title: Such a disappointment
data.text: We had such high hopes for this restaurant.  Unfortunately, it did not work out well.  It was a quiet Sunday night, not crowded and we had reservations.  However, it took over 45 minutes to get WATER, and another 20 minutes for our drinks to come - wine and beer, nothing fancy.  So, after waiting an hour to place drink and food orders, ALL of our food came at once - appetizers, soup, salad AND main course.  No room on the table, and no time to savor and enjoy.  The food itself was good, but the service was a disaster.  Will not be back with so many other excellent options nearby....

data.title: Good experience
data.text:
Had a long wait for a table on a wet night, but glad we did. The food is really good and service attentive. One negative is that although we appreciate wine prices are expensive in USA ( can never figure that one out) in this restaurant the cheapest bottle was 48 dollars - now that is just taking it a bit far. Have at least one reasonably priced wine on the menu.
But good food.

data.title: So good!!
data.text: We found this restaurant near our hotel. Service was fantastic and food was amazing. You must have the Brussel Sprout appetizer. Wish we lived closer to go again and again!!

data.title: Amazing
data.text: Stumbled upon this restaurant for lunch one day for my friend's birthday and we enjoyed it very much. The food was absolutely delicious. The drink menu was impressive as well. Would definitely recommend the fried chicken biscuit. So good!

data.title: food at it's best
data.text: I had a burger with bacon; it was a really outstanding experience; a really excellent meal; awsome; my wife ordered mussels and it was also tasty fresh and great. the service was quick and friendly, and last but not least try the californian red wine

data.title: Oysters
data.text:
Awesome happy hour 7 days a week featuring hot and cold oysters. 

Super nice staff and strong drinks. 
Southern hospitality is much appreciated coming from someone that lives in Los Angeles....thank you.

data.title: Gone downhill....
data.text:
The menu is far more limited than on previous visits, really struggled to choose an entre I really wanted beyond the beet salad I remember so fondly.

This time around the beet salad was served in a bowl making it very difficult to get all ingredients into each mouthful and make it difficult to actually eat and it just wasn't great anyway. For main I had the sausage and shrimp stew, forget the name which again was really not great and pretty greasy and a side of overly salty fries - thinking again I should really downgrade the review to poor as I really didn't enjoy it

Rob

data.title: Excellent Food and Service, Highly Recommended!
data.text: This place has it all. The bar is great (try their Sazerac, best in city), the food is as good as it gets along with first rate service. Located off St. Charles Street in NOLA makes it a must when in town. Try the stuffed oysters and crispy brussels sprouts as appetizers. The Gulf Shrimp "Etouffée" ala Harry was the best I have ever had and their hamburgers are amazing as well. If you have room for dessert you wont be disappointed, the "Steamed Chocolate", "Bourbon Vanilla Bean Crème Brûlée" and Brendan's Bread Pudding are all wonderful. Luke's is a must dining experience, a great spot!

data.title: Very Nice
data.text: walked to this restaurant from hotel and had a very good steak with grilled shrimp. this place is very comfortable and the food was great. a little pricey but worth it. will go back.

data.title: Not really French but fun
data.text: Bills itself as a French bistro style but that's stretching a bit. Nevertheless this noisy, informal and fun place provides a very enjoyable atmosphere and very decent food at reasonable prices. Sitting at the bar and watching the chef open the oysters was an education. Ate one of the best burgers I ever had. What is not to like

data.title: Nice dinner
data.text:
Our first evening in NOLA after a full day of travel.  Didn't really feel like going out and searching, luckily we walked out of our hotel and saw LUKE across the street.  Knowing nothing about it, we thought we'd try it out.    

Menu wasn't overly large but had several enticing options.  Their raw seafood bar also looked great.  This place felt like it was one of those places you can just go and hang out.

Service was very good and food was equally quite good.  Within an hour of landing I already had my first serving of shrimp & grits, even though they didn't call it than on the menu, the server told me that's what it was.

Well worth the visit!

data.title: Best meal our group had in our week in New Orleans
data.text: 6 of us (3 couples) had some meal ups and downs during our week in New Orleans. 'Luke' was hands down the best meal that we collectively enjoyed (as well the Service was professional and friendly). We sampled a number similar themed restaurants (looking in particular for great seafood) and Luke beat them all. Their raw bar seafood platters were fantastic (and generous in size), the recommended entree, jumbo shrimp and grits was also delicious (they will make a grit lover out of you if you weren't before, as was the case with more than one of us). We sampled a lot of gumbos and bisques over the week, and Luke's crab and corn bisque was by far the best we had anywhere (I could've easily had a second bowl). The steamed chocolate dessert was also a group favourite.

data.title: Excellent Food and Service
data.text: Just ate at Luke on St.Charles in NOLA... wonderful attentive service and the food was perfect... Seafood gumbo was the best I've ever had! Oysters were fresh and delicious... I will dine here again...

data.title: Great food, solid service.
data.text: We visited New Orleans for the weekend and were able to get in without a reservation at about 9:50 Saturday evening - late I know, but that's when we we're ready to get out of the FQ and have a late, light meal.  We had the Crispy Brussels Sprouts to start and they are great.  Very interesting flavor combination.  Then I had the Stuffed P&J Oysters appetizer, which I loved, and my wife had the shrimp etouffee with house made pasta.  She really enjoyed her dish.  Service was very good, but with one lull where the server was not there for a period.  But overall it was a treat to eat at a John Besh restaurant and we weren't disappointed.  A perfect end to our evening out and a short walk to our hotel.

data.title: Great happy hour
data.text: Another John besh restaurant that maintains a quality and class of food and drink beyond the norm.  The service and attention to detail hits you as soon as you enter the doors.  The quality of the food is consistently excellent

data.title: Meunière
data.text: Well prepared gulf drum fish meunière, with just enough texture on outside. Complimented well by perfectly crisped and piping hot sweet potatoes! The sauce for the fish comes separate so you can adjust if you don't want it smothered and actually want to enjoy the fish's flavor. Service was friendly and attentive.

data.title: So good I had to review another visit to Luke
data.text: I am several months late posting this.  However, I had to write a second review, because it is so important to acknowledge consistent excellence! During our visit in May, we enjoyed crawfish bisque, the crawfish omelet,  matzo ball soup, and salad luke. The food was Fantastic!! The server was a little off, but he made up for this with two complimentary "to go"cups of champagne. That small gesture went a long way! I would highly recommend this restaurant, again.
